intro: Capsella andraeana, commonly known as the Andraean catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many showy, herbaceous plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Capsella andraeana is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
